Hi Ron,
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 Anthony should =
try collecting up here in Canada!=A0 Now THAT
is a challenge.=A0 I for one =
would be more than interested to know what you
have to offer and suggestion=
s would be more than appreciated.=A0 I'd be more
than happy to [ay in "lobs=
ter" or "hockey skates"! LOL!!!!
=A0
Kind regards,=A0 Mark
=A0
=A0

-----Or=
iginal Message-----
From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [mailto:nihontostudy=
@yahoogroups.com]On
Behalf Of Ron Hartmann
Sent: Wednesday, December 21, 20=
05 10:04 PM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Wh=
ere do you buy your Tsuba?


Anthony -

Sorry to sound like such a "merchan=
t" but if you're interested I can send
you some pictures of a very nice sel=
ection of good quality iron tsuba that
I'm selling. Most are $200 range, mo=
re or less. If you are new at this I
would be happy to recommend good ones =
that would help teach you about these
things. Some of these have been to a =
number of shows and are now kept home
so that I can keep my table at the sh=
ows, fresh. All are authentic, for
sure. The shows seem to have a wonderful=
 selection of nice quality tsuba
these days and that is good for the buyer,=
 bad for the seller since there is
such a "selection" to pick from. Anyway.=
..just thought I'd toss this idea
out to you. I've been around for going on=
 40 years...gosh, that's a little
frightening to put in writing!

Ron
STL
=
=A0 ----- Original Message -----
=A0 From: anwahi
=A0 To: nihontostudy@yaho=
ogroups.com
=A0 Sent: Wednesday, December 21, 2005 4:23 PM
=A0 Subject: [ni=
hontostudy] Where do you buy your Tsuba?


=A0 Hello,

=A0 I'm new here and=
 to collecting Tsuba. Where do you buy your Tsuba from?
=A0 I know there's =
several websites you can find with a Google search, an
=A0 occasional Token=
 Kai show like the one in SF, or Ebay (most look like
=A0 junk). I'm lookin=
g for good sources of authentic Tsuba. Obviously the
=A0 only way to be rea=
lly sure of authenticity is to purchase papered
=A0 Tsuba, but because I'm =
starting off I want some sources of authentic
=A0 Tsuba more reasonably pri=
ced. Any suggestions?

=A0 Thanks for your helpo in advance,
=A0 Anthony
